meanings.definition: Not brought up to date or made current
meanings.sent1: The old house looked unmodernized with its outdated appliances.
meanings.sent2: The unmodernized technology struggled to keep up with the new advancements.
meanings.sent3: The unmodernized computer tried to play a modern game but kept crashing.
meanings.sent4: Her unmodernized fashion sense made her stand out in a crowd of trendy outfits.
meanings.sent5: The unmodernized car sputtered and coughed as it tried to start, showing its age.

meanings.sent1: The unmodernized building lacked the sleek design of the new skyscrapers.
meanings.sent2: The unmodernized town still had cobblestone streets and gas lamps.
meanings.sent3: His unmodernized phone could only make calls and send texts, no fancy apps.
meanings.sent4: The unmodernized library felt like stepping back in time with its dusty shelves.
meanings.sent5: The unmodernized website had a clunky interface that was hard to navigate.
